thread.title: Clubs shocked by Patrick Bamford demands
thread.title_full: Clubs shocked by Patrick Bamford demands | Daily Mail Online

author: Charles Sale for the Daily Mail
title: Clubs shocked by Patrick Bamford demands
text:
English football’s crazy finances are such that even Middlesbrough’s new £6million striker Patrick Bamford, who has not scored a goal for almost two years, could make grand demands when sent out on loan by Chelsea to Norwich, Crystal Palace and Burnley.
All three clubs had to match his Chelsea wages of £40,000 a week, as well as fix up a free apartment for the goal-shy Bamford, pay his utility bills and organise a TV and broadband package with Sky Sports and movies.
Free housing, gas and electricity are normal perks for players sent out on loan from Premier League clubs, but it is unusual to have their TV subscriptions and internet covered too.
Patrick Bamford demanded his loan clubs arrange a free apartment for him and pay his bills
The striker joined Middlesbrough after playing on loan at Crystal Palace, Norwich and Burnley
Bamford never made a first team appearance for Chelsea despite spending years there
It is understood that Bamford’s father was insistent on those demands being met.
Foreign owners such as Massimo Cellino of Leeds believe loan signings can well afford to pay for their own accommodation, let alone their Sky viewing.
England Twenty20 specialist Tymal Mills hoped he would make a big enough impression in the three-match series against India to put him in the shop window for the Indian Premier League.
And the 90mph bowler appears to have done just that, with several IPL teams, including Kolkata, chasing a player who has to concentrate on T20 because a back condition restricts him to four express overs.
There is upset among some Sutton fans that the draw for the FA Cup sixth round will be staged on the Sunday after Blackburn v Manchester United — more than 24 hours before the non-Leaguers face Arsenal.
The fans’ grouse is that the timing deprives them of the glorious uncertainty of what happens next during the build-up to the biggest game in their club’s history.
BT Sport, who set the time for the draw, say Sunday evening has been a regular slot for the draw in recent seasons, even when there is a Monday evening match.
Sutton fans are disappointed the FA Cup quarter-final draw will take place before their clash
Sutton will face Arsenal in the fifth round after previously knocking out league side Leeds
It was noticeable at the funeral of Graham Taylor this week that there was no official top-brass representation from Aston Villa, whom he managed with such distinction.
There were plenty of former Villa players and staff in attendance, plus the six current personnel from Taylor’s time, but nobody from Villa’s executive.
A spokesman said the owner was abroad, the chief executive didn’t know Taylor and the company secretary, who was keen to go, was caught up in the transfer deadline-day aftermath. Villa have also invited Taylor’s family to a match.
EDDIE READY FOR 2019
Eddie Jones’s attention to detail saw the England rugby squad change hotels on Thursday from their Pennyhill Park base to Syon House near Twickenham a day earlier than usual.
This is to prepare the squad — who face France in the Six Nations on Saturday — for hotel hopping at the World Cup in Japan in 2019.
But Jones’s micro-management doesn’t extend to the music the RFU will play after every England try. The man in charge of the playlist will be choosing English rock classics. But Jones, who wouldn’t be drawn on whether he approved of music to rev up the atmosphere, pronounced: ‘They can play YMCA for all I care.’
Meanwhile, despite the England team being expected to have by far the most representatives in the Lions squad this summer, head coach Warren Gatland has chosen to attend the two other Six Nations matches this weekend.
Eddie Jones changed England's team hotel as they prepare to face France on Saturday
South African football chief Danny Jordaan, who led the bid and organisation of the 2010 World Cup, has chosen not to leave his home country since the FIFA-related arrests in Zurich in May 2015.
Nevertheless, Jordaan has emerged as a candidate for African representation on the FIFA Council and says he will travel to meetings.
Team GB’s record-breaking exploits at the Rio Olympics have hardly led to a sponsorship bonanza for the medal winners.
One of the few notable deals involves triathlon heroes the Brownlee brothers, who signed up with Aldi on Thursday, while swimmer Adam Peaty and hockey captain Kate Richardson-Walsh have become the faces of Quorn, replacing Mo Farah after his contract expired.
